title: Systems Engineer
description:
Är du en teknisk, flexibel och lösningsorienterad person som tycker om att arbeta med flödet kring krav och verifiering när det kommer till framtagning av försvarssystem?


Har du ett intresse av att arbeta med framtidens teknik i en innovativ och växande organisation och vill hjälpa till att skapa en tryggare vardag genom att utveckla IT-system som fokuserar på samverkan inom Sverige, NATO och dess allierade?


Då har vi rätt tjänst för dig!

##### **Din nya utmaning**


Vi söker en systemingenjör med ett intresse kring kravställning, kravanalys, kravnedbrytning samt att hålla koll och ta fram assuransen till hur dessa krav testas och verifieras.


Med en relativt liten och flexibel organisation så kommer du få en stor varians i arbetsuppgifter, arbeta inom hela projektflödet och få möjlighet att komma i kontakt med flertalet olika projekt och ta en central del i att leverera nya försvarsförmågor med kvalitet!

##### **Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**

* Kravanalys och identifikation inom aktiva och kommande projekt.
* Kravnedbrytning och allokering för att få tydliga krav på rätt delsystem.
* Upprätta kravspårbarhet för att säkerställa assurans mellan krav, design, implementation och tester.
* Inrätta verifieringsstrategier, var och när skall delsystem testas för att säkra en fungerande slutleverans.
* Ta fram testspecifikationer för olika delsystem inför testtillfällen.
* Genomförande och analys av testresultat för att säkerställa att systemet fungerar enligt kraven.

##### **Det här bidrar du med**

* Du har en kandidatexamen eller motsvarande utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemutveckling, elektronik eller mekatronik.
* Förmåga att analysera komplexa system och identifiera problem i ett tidigt skede.
* Skriva tekniska rapporter, kravdokument och testplaner på ett tydligt sätt.
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med tvärfunktionella team med flera discipliner.
* Förståelse kring Systems Engineering processer inkl.
	+ Kravanalys och specifikation
	+ Spårbarhet och förändringshantering
	+ Testmetodik och strategi

Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Du talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska.

##### **Varför MilDef?**


På MilDef får du arbeta i en engagerad och stöttande miljö där dina idéer och insatser värdesätts. Du kommer att ha möjligheter till kontinuerligt lärande och karriärutveckling samt arbeta i en teamorienterad miljö som främjar innovation och samarbete.

##### **Vad vi erbjuder dig**

* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal inkl. bra försäkringar
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar
* Happiness team som ordnar roliga aktiviteter
* Arbete i helt nybyggda lokaler i Rosersberg

##### **Ansökan**


Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team, skicka din ansökan snarast. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com. För information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Viktor Attoff, Head of Software Services, på viktor.attoff@mildef.com.


Vi påbörjar urvalsprocessen efter ansökningstidens slut den 19 oktober.

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***

*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for defense and security domains. MilDef provides hardware, software and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest.*  

  

*MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*

**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

  

#LI-LB1

title: QA Engineer
description:
**QA Engineer at Coody**


Looking for the freedom of freelancing with the security of a full-time job? At Coody, we offer the best of both worlds, high salary, full benefits, and the flexibility to work remotely on cutting-edge projects.

  

On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%. How do we do it?


The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs - no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: **you**.

  

Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life for your own priorities - **Gravity Free Consulting**

**WHY COODY?**

* Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
* Freedom & Flexibility: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
* Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Topgolf, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Volvo Cars, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.

 **ABOUT US**


Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consists of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.


We’re more than a company - we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We cut through bureaucracy to focus on what matters - our consultants. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.  

  

  



**WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**


As a QA Engineer consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.


You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute to well tested and launch ready products and applications to match users and stakeholders requirements. You're also an important person to automate the test-cycle.


You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

 **WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

* 5+ years of experience working as a QA Engineer
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done

 **WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**

**Background** in building test frameworks and test cases for apps, web, backend, infrastructure or embedded

**Experience** with testing tools such as Selenium, Gtest, Pytest, Appium, Scripting etc.

**Technical expertise** in at least a couple of programming languages together with version control and other common tools like Git, Gitlab, CVS, Subversion, Jira, Confluence

**A Solid understanding** of CI/CD pipelines

**Knowledge** about requirement management towards software developers and other stakeholders

**A degree** in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field


Excited to take your career to the next level? Apply now, and we'll be in touch!

title: Embedded Software Application Engineer
description:
**Embedded Software Application Engineer**
==========================================

**Assignment Description**
--------------------------


We are looking for an experienced Embedded Software Application Engineer to take on a combined role with both leadership and technical responsibility. You will play a central part in guiding the team, removing obstacles, securing deliveries, and leading agile routines. In parallel, you will oversee the full lifecycle of ECUs and embedded software, from requirement handling and planning to release and maintenance. The role also includes coordinating development activities, ensuring compliance with technical, quality, cost, and time targets, and contributing to integration, testing, and stakeholder collaboration.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Support, coach, and guide the team in daily work
* Lead agile routines and ensure deliveries are secured
* Manage the lifecycle of ECUs and embedded software (requirements, planning, release, maintenance)
* Coordinate development activities and align with project goals
* Ensure compliance with technical, quality, cost, and time objectives
* Contribute to integration and testing of embedded solutions
* Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders

**Required Qualifications**
---------------------------

* Documented leadership background with proven ability to guide teams
* Strong communication skills combined with analytical and problem-solving ability
* Practical experience in embedded software and hardware development within the automotive sector
* Familiarity with ECU functions and related technical areas
* Academic degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s) in software, electrical engineering, or similar field
* Knowledge of safety standards such as ISO 26262
* Proficiency with tools, processes, and systems used in embedded development
* Structured, proactive mindset with ability to collaborate effectively

**Start/Duration**
------------------


Start: 2025-10-01  

Duration: Until 2026-09-30 (extension possible)

**Location**
------------


Gothenburg, Sweden (on-site)

### **About Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
Telness Tech is on a mission to simplify and digitize the telecom industry. Our platform powers next-generation mobile providers, from traditional MVNOs to eSIM challengers and non-telecom players looking to embed connectivity into their offerings. With our roots in Stockholm and our sights on a global scale, we’re building the future of telecom—fast, flexible, and customer-first.
   

  

 As we accelerate our growth, we’re seeking Senior Software Engineers to help us become the global leader in #teltech.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will work with a team of skilled engineers and build modern architecture and technology. Our backend is built in Golang and runs in AWS using Kubernetes. Communication between backend services utilizes gRPC, and the frontend uses React. We use both GraphQL and REST, and primarily use PostgreSQL databases with event sourcing.
   

  

 We are scaling up our platform to new markets with dynamic requirements, and you will play a crucial role in shaping, designing, and building fundamental components. As the company expands, you will help us tackle new and interesting challenges, scaling our platform from tens of thousands to hundreds of millions of users.
   

  

 We have openings in multiple teams, and hiring will be based on your background, skills, and technical interests. For the right person, there are opportunities to take on a leading technical role, whether from day one or over time, helping the team build a clear technical vision and make strategic technology choices as we scale.
   

  

**About You**
 You are an experienced Sr. Software Engineer who has probably worked at several companies, including at least one startup, and has grown with them from an early stage. You are currently working with Go (or a similar) in a full-stack, backend-focused role and are comfortable diving into occasional front-end work with React. You are excited about joining a startup journey where you will shape both product and technology while working in a small, high-autonomy team.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Table**
* 5+ years as a backend/full-stack engineer in a modern tech environment.
* Strong experience with Go (Golang) and SQL (bonus for GraphQL, React, Typescript).
* Ability to collaborate effectively and solve complex technical problems as part of a team.
* Passion for technology and excitement for the challenges of continuously adapting technology and working methods to support our scaling journey.
* Take ownership of your growth and support the development of others, eager to learn and share knowledge.
* Drives technical and process improvements, actively seeking ways to enhance technology and workflows, with a motivation to implement positive changes for both the team and the company.
* Autonomous, self-motivated, likes new challenges, and takes responsibility.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high proficiency in English.


**Why Telness Tech?**
 We’re not building for telco as it is—we’re building for how it should be: fast-moving, easy to use, and built for the people who use it. At Telness Tech, you’ll join a curious, ambitious, and transparent team. We work hard, we move fast, and we support each other every step of the way.
   

  

 Here’s what you can expect:
   

  

* Be part of an exciting startup journey with strong funding and international expansion.
* Play an active role in building one of the telecom industry’s most innovative companies.
* A high-trust, high-autonomy environment where you’ll be encouraged to take ownership and explore growth opportunities for both Telness Tech and your development.
* A friendly, positive, and supportive workplace that fosters collaboration and constructive challenge.
* Free daily breakfast, regular "Friday" AWs, and fun activities!
* Hybrid/remote work setup with an office in central Stockholm.


 Sounds like your challenge?
   

  

 Let’s talk.
   

  

*Currently, we are unable to support work permits or relocation.*

title: Software Developer C/C++, Embedded Systems
description:
The industry is going through big changes - the transformation to the smart and connected factory. Join our multinational team in Sickla and develop innovative solutions for sustainable and flexible industrial production to customers worldwide. Our vision is to be First in Mind—First in Choice.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 As a Software developer in our team, you will design and implement platform software and functions mainly for our world class assembly tools supporting automated and flexible industrial production. You will work in cross-functional and agile teams together with other development disciplines and be involved in all steps of the process - from first idea to product. You will work with time critical embedded systems as a part of one of our product projects. You will develop low level SW in our microcontroller platform and perform some verification.
   

  

**Some Examples Of What We Work With**
* Low level driver development
* STM32 microcontrollers
* GIT/Gerrit version management system
* Jenkins
* Linux
* FreeRTOS


 To succeed, you will need
   

  

 You are a team player with customer focus, who wants to embrace new challenges and take on new learnings. You are fluent in English and enjoy interacting and collaborating locally and worldwide.
   

  

 You are fluent in English.
   

  

 You have an academic degree in mechatronics, computer science, electrical engineering or other relevant background.
   

  

**You Need To Have Experience Of**
* C and C++ programming
* Microcontroller Based Embedded System
* HW related SW
* RTO


 Our selection process includes interviews and for some roles skills assessments to gain a deeper insights into your profile. We're eager to get to know you, hear about your skills, and discuss your potential to grow with us.
   

  

 In return, we offer
   

  

 At Atlas Copco, we have a friendly, family-like atmosphere and a culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behavior and integrity. We offer opportunities to grow and develop, as well as potential to see your ideas realized and make an impact. As part of the Atlas Copco Group, you have access to global job opportunities.
   

  

 Job location
   

  

 This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, allowing you to split your time between working remotely and being on-site in Stockholm, Sweden (SE).
   

  

 Contact information
   

  

 Please contact the hiring manager Jens Svensson, jens.svensson@atlascopco.com, for more information.
   

  

**Uniting curious minds**
 Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.

title: Software Engineer - Java/AWS/DevOps
description:
**Job Description**
 Software Engineer - Java/AWS/DevOps
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution .
   

  

**The O pportunity**
 At Worldline, delivering a fantastic payment experience that our customers love is what drives us forward . Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing & settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled product - oriented DevOps Software Engineer to team up with one of our product-oriented DevOps teams.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 Our autonomous teams work with a lean product focused DevOps culture that continuously delivers true outcome, and if you build it, you run it! This means that you are responsible for :
   

  

* Active participation and contribution in all phases of the product lifecycle including discovery, delivery and operations
* Delivering your team’s committed objectives , adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and your team have committed yourselves to reach
* Securing an outstanding quali ta tive service availability 24/7/365 and on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule


 You love identifying the outcomes to be achieved together with your team, our customers, our internal users, other stakeholders and suppliers to deliver a truly outstanding acquiring processing experience for our customer and our business to love.
   

  

**What Makes You Stand Out**
* You are a junior to mid-experienced Software Engineer used to full-cycle DevOps mode
* You have been developing in Java/AWS for some time exposed to micro-services and serverless technologies
* Have highly collaborative attitude , setting your team first while also successfully collaborating with others
* You are comfortable in a fast-moving and agile culture - handling many different stakeholders, prioritizations and fast decisions is not an issue for you
* If y ou have previous experience from the card-payment industry, preferably acquiring processing or other transaction intense industry where scale is important that’s a big advantage
* Being p assionate about delivering a payment acquiring experience that brings value for our customers and our business
* A cting as a role model for your team and others by paying attention to commitment, accountability and the true outcome for yourself, your team, our customers and internal users


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You also have :
   

  

* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering or other meaningful field Have confirmed experience in software development including Java, Python and SQL etc.
* Experience from high-available micro-services and serverless architecture and design leveraging on the AWS cloud for scalability and resilience.
* As a result, we would like you also to have some experience in/interest for
* AWS cloud services including DynamoDB, Lambdas, S3 etc.
* Infrastructure as code using Terraform and CloudFormation
* Continuous delivery pipelines using Jenkins and GIT
* Docker
* Knowledge secure coding
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles
* Fluency in English (Swedish is an advantage)
* Valid working permit for Sweden (office location is Stockholm)


**Skills We’d Like**
* Experience from DevOps ways of working and lean culture
* Paying attention to commitment, accountability and result for yourself and for your team.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage
* Good communication and presentation abilities
* Challenging status quo
* Having a technical and curious mindset, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2: nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we are looking for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on society . And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

 Learn more about life at Worldline at job s.worldline.com
   

  

 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color , national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Legal Engineer
description:
**About Legora**
 We founded Legora with a simple thesis: AI is going to fundamentally change how legal work gets done. In 2023, we started as a startup called Leya in the basement of the biggest law firm in the Nordics. Through shared efforts, mutual growth, and true problem-solving, we built a product tailored to the needs of lawyers at the top firms. The spirit from those days remains.
   

  

 Today, Legora is the world’s first truly collaborative AI for lawyers. The platform is embedded in thousands of lawyers' everyday life in nearly 20 countries by over 250 clients, and helps them work more efficiently, accurately, and devote more time to complex problem solving and high-impact, strategic work.
   

  

 With offices in New York, London and Stockholm, we are on a mission to empower exceptional lawyers by unleashing their expertise. Our team of product builders and lawyers ship fast and innovate - with our users and clients.
   

  

 That’s where you come in...
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 Let’s get the tricky part out of the way: this role doesn’t fit neatly into a traditional box. It’s part legal ops, part product specialist, part solutions architect, and part client whisperer. If you enjoy roles that stay static, this probably isn’t it. Your mission is to help our clients, some of the most respected legal teams in the world, get the absolute most out of our platform.
   

  

**Some Of What You’ll Be Up To**
* Acting as a thought partner to clients - building trusted relationships, addressing tricky pain points, and identifying high-value opportunities for them to scale their use of Legora.
* Working together with Customer Success in taking full ownership of client relationship - from running pilots in the early stages, to onboarding new users, and ultimately guiding full-firm adoption across major law firms and corporate legal departments.
* Be the voice of the user inside Legora - sharing insights that directly inform product development, roadmap priorities, and strategic direction.
* Delivering clear, confident product demos and training that bring the power of our platform to life.
* Documenting best practices, contribute to the development of scalable playbooks, and help shape how we grow this function globally.
* Confidently helping our clients navigate one of the biggest shifts in how the legal business operates - from evaluating the ROI and impact of AI to clearly mapping how AI will impact different practice areas


**What You Bring**
 You come from the world of law; but you’ve never been content with how things have always been done. You may have started out at a top-tier law firm. Maybe you’ve worked in a corporate legal team, seeing thorny operational problems from the inside. Perhaps you've even tried disrupting the status-quo through a legal tech company, or ventures of your own. Either way, you've had experience beyond the traditional legal career path. Either way, you know how legal teams think, work, and (sometimes) struggle and you're ready to help them level up with technology.
   

  

**You’ll Thrive In This Role If You**
* Have a background in law, with experience at a top-tier firm or in-house legal team.
* Are tech-curious and product-savvy. Not necessarily a coder, but passionate navigating technical conversations, especially around things like generative AI, technology implementation, innovation and productivity .
* Communicate clearly and confidently with diverse stakeholders, both lawyers and engineers. I.e. translating across disciplines is second nature to you.
* Bring structure to ambiguity and energy to complexity; and enjoy being the calm, credible presence in a fast-moving environment.
* Understand how to evaluate and improve existing processes as a direct result of new and emerging technologies
* Are proactive, self-directed, and comfortable juggling multiple client relationships at once.
* Care deeply about quality, but don’t get stuck in perfectionism - you get things done, and you make them better over time.


**A few more things**
 We’re a fast-growing company with bold ambitions, so you’ll be joining at a time when things are moving quickly - in the best possible way. You’ll have a lot of autonomy, a lot of responsibility, and the chance to genuinely shape how this (organisation) function evolves. Everyone here has a founder-mentality.
   

  

 If that sounds exciting rather than terrifying, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Backend Engineer - Billing & Subscriptions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Billing & Subscriptions team, you'll build the robust systems that power how customers pay for and manage their clean energy solutions. You'll focus on creating secure, scalable backend services that handle billing, payments, and subscription management across multiple markets.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Design and build APIs and backend services for billing, payments, and subscription management
* Integrate with payment gateways, banks, and third-party financial services
* Develop automated billing systems, invoice generation, and subscription lifecycle management
* Create secure, scalable systems that handle financial data and transactions
* Build internal tools and services that support our finance operations
* Help scale our payment infrastructure across multiple markets and currencies


 We're making clean energy financing simple and reliable. If you enjoy building robust backend systems that handle mission-critical financial operations, this role is for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Experience with Java (Spring framework preferred)
* Strong understanding of databases and data modeling
* Experience building APIs and backend services
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality, well-tested code
* Interest in financial systems and payment processing


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with financial or payment applications
* Security best practices for financial systems
* Experience at fast-growing companies
* Knowledge of microservices architecture


**What is in it for you?**
* Work at a fast-growing clean energy company making a real environmental impact
* Collaborate with international teams and launch products globally
* Build systems that directly impact our core business operations
* Hybrid work flexibility at our new Stockholm office near public transport
* Supportive, inclusive culture with career advancement opportunities


 At Aira, we believe diverse teams build better products. We welcome people from all backgrounds to help us create a cleaner energy future.

title: Backend Engineer - Customer Solutions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Customer Solutions team, you'll build the intelligent systems that power Aira's growth across Europe. This role sits within our Customer Acquisition area, where you'll develop critical backend infrastructure including intelligent recommendation systems, dynamic pricing optimization, and market expansion capabilities. Working in an agile environment with cross-functional teams, you'll help scale our technical platform across diverse European markets while handling complex technical and regulatory requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build and maintain our customer solution matching platform—the backend systems that analyze customer inputs and property characteristics to recommend optimal clean energy solutions
* Develop scalable backend services that enable market teams with pricing capabilities and support company bets on new products through intelligent algorithms
* Create flexible, event-driven systems that can easily onboard new clean energy products and adapt to different markets, currencies, and regulatory requirements
* Design and implement APIs and microservices that support rapid geographic expansion while maintaining high performance and reliability


 We're transforming how clean energy solutions are discovered and delivered across Europe through smart backend systems. If you enjoy building scalable systems that directly drive business growth and enable market expansion in a mission-driven environment, this role offers exceptional technical challenges and impact.
   

  

 What you bring to the team
   

  

  

* Strong experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Solid understanding of databases and data modeling (SQL and NoSQL)
* Experience with automated testing (unit tests, integration tests)
* Experience building scalable, distributed systems
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and containerization
* Knowledge of modern development practices (CI/CD, code reviews, agile methodologies)


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with recommendation engines, pricing algorithms, or matching systems
* Database experience (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka, message queues)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
* Experience at fast-growing companies expanding into new markets


 Please note:
   

  

 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

 What is in it for you?
   

  

**Impact & Growth**
* Build systems that directly drive Aira's expansion across Europe and enable market teams
* Work on challenging technical problems including recommendation engines and pricing optimization
* Develop expertise in clean energy markets while contributing to meaningful climate action
* Build scalable infrastructure that supports rapid business growth and product diversification


**Team & Culture**
* Collaborate with talented, mission-driven teams across multiple disciplines and international markets
* Work in an agile, fast-paced environment with modern engineering practices
* Enjoy mentorship opportunities and career development in a growing engineering organization


**Work Environment**
* Hybrid work model with flexibility to balance office and remote work
* Brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm, conveniently located near Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations
* Competitive compensation and benefits package


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: (Senior) Integration Automation Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services – Group Digital Office Directorate (GCS-GDO) – Platforms & Services Department (P&S) – Integration Division (INT) – Integration Platform Services Unit (IPSU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Integration Automation Engineer\*** 
 .
   

  

**This is a full time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from May 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you passionate about enhancing efficiency, speed and reliability in software delivery? You will play a crucial role by breaking down traditional silos between development and operations teams, and weaving seamlessly security practices into the software development lifecycle?
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report directly to the Head of Unit and will work in close contact with the unit’s Platform Leads and with the other IT units.
   

  

 The Unit focuses on providing and managing integration services, providing integration platforms that play a crucial role in connecting diverse applications, systems, and data sources within an organization to ensure seamless communication and data flow.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Architect, design, and implement CI/CD pipelines
* Implement Infrastructure as Code practices to automate the provisioning and configuration of development, testing, and production environments. Leverage tools like Terraform or Ansible to ensure consistency across environments.
* Design and implement automation of cloud-native services (e.g., AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, API Gateway) to reduce operational complexity and enhance system resilience.
* Collaborate with development and quality assurance teams to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipelines.
* Implement automated deployment processes to deliver software releases consistently and reliably.
* Continuously optimize and enhance CI/CD processes to improve build and deployment efficiency.
* Implement and manage automated security testing tools and processes to seamlessly integrate security into the CI/CD pipeline and ensure continuous compliance.
* Promote a security-conscious culture by providing training and awareness programs.
* Review analysis and proposed technical solutions prepared by more junior staff for consistency with business and functional requirements and IT plans in order to assess technical and business feasibility.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in integration automation, cloud engineering, or infrastructure automation, with strong background in software development including the supervision of technical teams.
* Experience with cloud services and platforms, such as AWS and/or Azure. Understanding of cloud security best practices and securing applications and data in cloud.
* Extensive experience with CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI, Travis CI, CircleCI, or others.
* Experience in integration concepts, such as API, event streaming, SOA and ESB would be a nice to have.
* Experience with automation tools such as Maven, Gradle, npm, Ansible, Puppet, or Chef would be a nice to have.
* Strong experience with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles, using tools like Terraform.
* Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes as nice to have.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, or Bash as nice to have.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*
